title: Part. motion, given v(t) and s(0). part - a

content.description: A particle moves along a straight line. For 0 ≤ t ≤5 , the velocity of the particle is given by v(t)=-2+(t2+3t)6/5-t3, and the position of the particle is given by s(t). It is known that s(0)=10.
content.question: Find all values of t in the interval 2 ≤ t ≤ 4 for which the speed of the particle is 2.

frqParts.text: Find all values of t in the interval 2 ≤ t ≤ 4 for which the speed of the particle is 2.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
